entry.title: Berkshelf a vagrant plugin
entry.content:
Berkshelf is a bundler-like dependency manger for Chef cookbook. vagrant-berkshelf is a Vagrant plugin to add Berkshelf integration to Chef provisioners to avoid the need to install cookbooks locally and have everything ready when you bring vagrant up.

How to use?

Install vagrant-berkshelf

$ vagrant plugin install vagrant-berkshelf

Enable it in Vagrantfile 

Vagrant.configure(“2”) do |config|
  …
  config.berkshelf.enabled = true
  …
end

Generate a Berksfile in the root of your project

site :opscode
cookbook ‘apt’
cookbook ‘build-essential’</p>

<p>cookbook ‘ruby_build’, git: ‘<a href="https://github.com/fnichol/chef-ruby_build.git">https://github.com/fnichol/chef-ruby_build.git</a>’
cookbook ‘rbenv’, git: ‘<a href="https://github.com/fnichol/chef-rbenv.git">https://github.com/fnichol/chef-rbenv.git</a>’</p>

<p>cookbook ‘vim’, path: ‘./cookbooks/vim’</p>

<p>

That’s it! vagrant up

entry.title: Manage your cookbooks with librarian-chef
entry.content:
librarian-chef is like a bundler for cookbooks. Manage your cookbooks and dependencies in a single file.

Here is how

$ gem install librarian-chef
$ librarian-chef init</p>

<h1>edit the newly created Cheffile to add your cookbooks</h1>

<p>$ librarian-chef install

Cookboks listed in the Cheffile will be downloaded to the cookbooks folder, you will also noticed a Cheffile.lock is created locking the versions.

Here is an example:

</p>

<h1>!/usr/bin/env ruby</h1>

<h1>^syntax detection</h1>

<p>site ‘<a href="http://community.opscode.com/api/v1">http://community.opscode.com/api/v1</a>’
cookbook ‘apt’
cookbook ‘git’
cookbook ‘build-essential’
cookbook ‘tmux’</p>

<h1>Include cookbooks from github</h1>

<p>cookbook ‘ruby_build’,</p>

<pre><code>      :git => 'https://github.com/fnichol/chef-ruby_build.git'
</code></pre>

<p>cookbook ‘rbenv’,</p>

<pre><code>      :git => 'https://github.com/fnichol/chef-rbenv.git',
      :ref => 'v0.7.2'
</code></pre>
